body.p: Maj I L Frost having been indicted before the Sept and Nov term of the Fayette Circuit Court on the charge of receiving a small mare knowing at the time that siad mare was the property of T Bacy and had been stolen her.

I herby make the following statement. I was at Maj Frosts house at the time said mare was received. And know that Maj Frost purchased her and paid $63 65/100 for her. I was in the house at the time the trade was made but was present when the contact was closed and the bill of sale was given and considered at a fair and legitimate transaction between the parties. And am confident that Maj Frost did not know that said mare belong to T Bacy or any one else but the party of whom he purchased her
to the best of my recolection the statement is correct
Sworn to and subscribed in my Presents this 9 of November 1865
M B Johnson J P f c
